cycloneMessage.systemGeoRefPt1: ABOUT 1200 MI...1930 KM W OF THE SOUTHERN TIP OF BAJA CALIFORNIA
cycloneMessage.message:
ZCZC MIATCPEP5 ALL TTAA00 KNHC DDHHMM
BULLETIN Tropical Storm Irwin Advisory Number 40 NWS National Hurricane Center Miami FL EP102017 200 AM PDT Tue Aug 01 2017
...IRWIN EXPECTED TO BECOME A REMNANT LOW BY TONIGHT...
SUMMARY OF 200 AM PDT...0900 UTC...INFORMATION ---------------------------------------------- LOCATION...24.9N 128.8W ABOUT 1200 MI...1930 KM W OF THE SOUTHERN TIP OF BAJA CALIFORNIA MAXIMUM SUSTAINED WINDS...45 MPH...75 KM/H PRESENT MOVEMENT...NNW OR 335 DEGREES AT 13 MPH...20 KM/H MINIMUM CENTRAL PRESSURE...1007 MB...29.74 INCHES
WATCHES AND WARNINGS -------------------- There are no coastal watches or warnings in effect.
DISCUSSION AND 48-HOUR OUTLOOK ------------------------------ At 200 AM PDT (0900 UTC), the center of Tropical Storm Irwin was located near latitude 24.9 North, longitude 128.8 West. Irwin is moving toward the north-northwest near 13 mph (20 km/h), and this motion is expected to continue this morning. A slower motion toward the northwest should begin later today.
Maximum sustained winds are near 45 mph (75 km/h) with higher gusts. Weakening is forecast during the next couple of days, and Irwin is expected to degenerate into a remnant low later today or tonight.
Tropical-storm-force winds extend outward up to 35 miles (55 km) from the center.
The estimated minimum central pressure is 1007 mb (29.74 inches).
HAZARDS AFFECTING LAND ---------------------- None.
NEXT ADVISORY ------------- Next complete advisory at 800 AM PDT.
$$ Forecaster Brown
NNNN
